availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel H. Bullen (Jefferson County, Kentucky, boarding house keeper. )

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, boarding house keeper. Maryland native. Son of John Bullen and Mary Bullen. Married to Carolina "Carrie" Oliver Bullen in Jefferson County, Kentucky on February 15, 1834. Father of Lenora Bullen, Joseph Oliver Bullen, Mary Bullen, Caroline Bullen, Samuel Bullen, John E. Bullen, and Catherine Bullen. Boarding house keeper in Louisville in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Boarding house keeper in Louisville in 1860. Employed Mary Murphy and Brigette (Unknown) as servants in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 3, p. 249A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 3, p.834 and 838.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Ward 6, p. 350-1.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #00482706, p. 125.
